awards.description: THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF WHITE MOUNTAIN IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH.  TASKS INCLUDE MANAGING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE TO SUSTAIN A SUCCESSFUL TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; IMPLEMENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING AND RESEARCH; AND DEVELOP SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, BACKHAUL, ORGANIZE ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP, AND RECYCLING.

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF WHITE MOUNTAIN WILL USE GAP FUNDING TO ADDRESS PRIORITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS IN THE COMMUNITY. ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING AND BUILDING MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING PROGRAMMATIC GROWTH TO MAINTAIN MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. KEY AREAS OF FOCUS INCLUDE ESTABLISHING PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND EDUCATION, ADDRESSING SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT ISSUES, AND PROTECT WATERSHED INHABITANTS/SUBSISTENCE FOODS BY ESTABLISHING WATER QUALITY BASELINE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THE GRANT WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SKILLS RELEVANT TO THE TRIBE'S PRIORITIES. ANOTHER KEY ELEMENT OF THIS PROGRAM INVOLVES COLLECTION OF SOLID WASTE FOR LANDFILL DISPOSAL, SEPARATION OF E-WASTE FROM SOLID WASTE AND ORGANIZING A COMMUNITY CLEAN UP, ULTIMATELY ENHANCING MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. FINALLY, COLLECTING WATER QUALITY DATA WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL TO ACHIEVING ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS, INCLUDING PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH, WATERSHED, AND SUBSISTENCE FOODS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FROM THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF WHITE MOUNTAIN WILL INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO EPA, OUTLINING PROGRESS TOWARDS ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS IN PRIORITY AREAS. IN ADDITION, TRIP REPORTS WILL OUTLINE TECHNICAL CAPACITIES GAINED FROM ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES. FINALLY, DOCUMENTATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL CLEAN-UPS, COMMUNITY TRAININGS AND EVENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE ACCOMPLISHMENTS RESULTING FROM THESE WORK PLAN COMMITMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.
